text: this is an abandoned Soviet military
base in western hungary 2000 members of
the radar River stationed here during
the Cold War it was a thriving town now
it's all in ruins Marika was 15 years
old when she got a job at the community
center it was in 1955 a year later came
the Hungarian Revolution the western
states this is where I worked
sadly a lot of Russian troops died
during the 1956 revolution their bodies
learned state here in the cinema then
the bodies were transported home
[Music]
to desert to our - for $1 during the
revolution stocks at the Russians shop
were depleted those poor devils with
families they couldn't buy anything in
the stores the shop windows were empty
there was no bread there was no milk my
employer the mother of the child I
looked after asked me to bring some
bread and milk from the village so she
could feed the child in her home village
Mariko got into trouble for taking food
to the Russians a man threatened to
subject her to revolutionary justice not
on fire my heart aches when I come here
I can see rubbish everywhere it's a mess
people in the village call it a ghost
town Derek Silva this was the child's
room from here you could go through to
the parents room we spent a lot of time
here with the little boy we would also
go out to the balcony to have a look
around and sit there when the weather
was good it makes me feel awful seeing
how this place deteriorated from what it
was when I worked here
